O 17 de Junho representa o Dia Mundial de Combate à Desertificação, sendo a ONU o órgão que estipulou a data. No Brasil existem 982.563 km² de região semiárida, sendo que destes, cerca de 600 mil km² já foram gravemente atingidos nos últimos anos. 

Assim, torna-se importante termos um momento para refletir sobre os impactos da desertificação no contexto brasileiro e pensar em possibilidades para minimizar os danos deste fenômeno que atinge diversas regiões do nosso país.
.
.
.

.

.

La désertification a joué un rôle important dans l'histoire humaine, contribuant à l'effondrement de plusieurs grands empires et au déplacement de populations locales. Aujourd'hui, le rythme de la dégradation des terres est estimé à 35 fois le taux historique, selon l'UN, les terres se sont alors épuisées et les eaux souterraines sont surexploitées.
#hespressfr #worlddaytocombatdesertificationanddrought #desertification #saveearth

יום המדבוּר
~
מה זה מדבוּר בכלל? למה מציינים יום ׳לכבודו׳? ולמה זה מעניין אותנו?
~
לכל דבר ותופעה בעולם הזה נהיה יום מיוחד
לפעמים זה משעשע, או מציק או נשמע מיותר
אבל דווקא על מדבוּר, שזה על-פניו משהו נישתי ולא חשוב, החלטתי להתעכב
~
תופעת המדבוּר היא הפיכת קרקעות לצחיחות לחלוטין, והתפשטות המדבריות בעולם
(וגם כאן, בישראל הקטנה שלנו, זו בעיה אמיתית)

‎🌵 זו בעיה כי הקרקע מאבדת את החיוניות שלה, ולא ניתן לגדל עליה גידולים חקלאיים
‎🌵פגיעה במערכת האקולוגית - פחות צמחים, פחות חיות
‎🌵פחות צמחים - פחות קליטת פחמן ופחות ייצור חמצן

למה זה קורה?
שינויי אקלים, בין אם טבעיים ובין אם כתוצאה מפעולות האדם 
וניצול יתר של הקרקע - כמו ע״י מרעה בקנה מידה מסחרי שפשוט הורס את הצמחייה, שמחזיקה את הקרקע ומעשירה אותה.
~
מה עושים? 
קודם כל מודעות - להשפעה שלנו על כדור הארץ, איך הכל קשור בהכל, ואיך הכל בסוף חוזר אלינו
נטיעת עצים
שימוש מושכל בקרקע ובמים
מאבק בשינוי האקלים - הפחתת הזיהום, וטיפול בנזקים שהצטברו.
~
alumah צילום

En el Día de la Lucha contra la Desertificación y la Sequía queremos recordar que la restauración de las tierras degradadas contribuye a la resiliencia económica, a la creación de empleo, al aumento de los ingresos y a una mayor seguridad alimentaria; ayuda a recuperar la biodiversidad; permite capturar el carbono atmosférico, mitigando el efecto del cambio climático.

Today is the World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought!

The FAO’s Action Against Desertification supports local communities, government & civil society to sustainably 👇🏽
.
🌱 restore degraded land
🌱 manage fragile ecosystems
.
So far, the project helped 👇🏽
.
✅ put 63,000 hectares under restoration
✅ produce over 120 tons of seed and 12 million seedlings of 110 woody and herbaceous species
✅ involve 500 villages in restoration activities with the participation of 100,000 households

🇸🇪Sweden has had a longstanding cooperation with FAO. The activities of FAO embody perspectives that Sweden considers important in development cooperation;
the poverty perspective, the environment perspective and the climate perspective. 

If we act together, we can restore our ecosystems & protect our planet! Double tap if you agree!
.

Day 708: World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought. Global warming doesn't just affect the coldest parts of the planet, but some of the hottest and driest ones as well.
.
Desertification and land degradation, caused primarily from mining, urbanization, and agriculture, are only worsened by global warming. Especially in dryland areas where agriculture or other land uses are hard on the soil, the ground quickly snowballs to a desert-like state. If plants aren't able to keep the soil together, the soil can degrade further, allowing even less plant life to take hold.
.
It's a slippery situation that could end up affecting hundreds of millions of people. Currently, there are 2 billion people that live in dryland areas that could eventually be at risk of being displaced by desertification. But even by the end of this next decade, 50 million people around the world could be displaced by desertification.
.
Just like with the Paris Climate Agreement, the Convention to Combat Desertification involves 122 countries that have committed to keeping soil arable and managing freshwater supplies. One initiative, the Great Green Wall, aims to restore over 380,000 square miles of African soil by 2030. Another initiative in the Gobi Desert includes planting trees in northern China to stop the desert's spread.
.
.
Read more about desertification: https://www.nationalgeographic.com/environment/article/desertification
.
Graphic shows a small house in the desert. The factoid reads: "50 million people could be displaced by desertification by 2030."
.
.

💧🌎 Día Mundial de la Lucha Contra la Desertificación y la Sequía 🌎💧

👉🏻 Hoy 17 de junio se conmemora este día con fin de crear conciencia sobre la importancia que tiene dar soluciones a los problemas de desertificación y sequía.

🌱 La vegetación ayuda a reducir el riesgo de sequía, ya que aumenta la humedad, reduce la oxidación térmica y provee servicios ecosistémicos tales como regular caudales y controlar la dinámica del carbono.

🌵 Los paisajes degradados y poco planificados hacen que sea más difícil la sobrevivencia del bosque, por lo que la lucha contra la desertificación es también una lucha contra los paisajes degradados.

Every year, World Day to Combat Desertification & Drought is observed to promote public awareness of international efforts to combat desertification and drought, as well as to serve as a reminder that "... land degradation neutrality is achievable through problem-solving, strong community involvement and co-operation at all levels." (UN)
-
Land degradation is inextricably linked to the fashion industry. From badly managed terrestrial agriculture used to grow materials like cotton and hemp, to mass amounts of water used to process and dye clothing, fashion's exploitation of land and water cannot be understated.
-
"By 2030, the fashion industry is predicted to use 35 per cent more land – over 115 million hectares, equivalent to the size of Colombia." (UN)
.
.
.

Today we're raising awareness for World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought.

Through our demand for food, materials, and shelter, we have drastically changed the environment around us. Land degradation negatively impacts the lives of more than 3.2 billion people around the world. 

This year's goals outlined by unccd emphasize the need to invest in restoring land as part of a green recovery that has wide-reaching benefits:

🌎 Economic resilience by creating jobs & raising incomes 
🌍Increasing food security
🌏Protecting biodiversity 

#RestorationLandRecovery #DesertificationAndDroughtDay #EndLandLoss #climatecrisis #climatechange #desertification #drought #economicresiliency

El Día Mundial de Lucha Contra la Desertificación y la Sequía, se celebra el 17 de junio de cada año. El decreto fue establecido por la ONU, con el objetivo de crear conciencia de la importancia que tiene para los seres humanos y el planeta abordar y dar soluciones a los problemas de desertificación y sequía, los cuales representan graves problemas presentes y futuros para toda la humanidad.⠀
⠀
Para el año 2021 el tema central de la campaña de esta efeméride es "Suelo sano = gente sana" con Costa Rica como país anfitrión, el cual tiene como objetivo fundamental transformar las tierras degradadas en tierras sanas.⠀
⠀
Fuente: www.diainternacionalde.com

🏜Çölleşme; iklim değişikliği, erozyon, plansız sulama, biyolojik çeşitlilik kaybı ve tarım arazilerinin tahribatı gibi birçok konu ile doğrudan ilişkilidir.

👉‘’Ülkemizde kentleşme, alt yapı yatırımları vb. nedenlerle 3.5 milyon hektar tarım toprağı yok olmuş durumda. Kalan tarım topraklarının %39’u ve mera alanlarının %54’ü ise erozyon tehlikesi altında.’’

🛎Her bir birey, özel sektör, kamu ve STK’lar üzerine düşen sorumluluğu yerine getirmeli.

🏜Desertification; It is directly related to many issues such as climate change, erosion, unplanned irrigation, loss of biodiversity and destruction of agricultural lands.

👉“In our country, urbanization, infrastructure investments, etc. due to reasons, 3.5 million hectares of agricultural land have been destroyed. 39% of the remaining agricultural lands and 54% of the pasture lands are at risk of erosion.’’

🛎Each individual, private sector, public and NGO’ must fulfill their responsibilities.

Held on June 17th, Desertification and Drought Day is focused on turning degraded land into healthy land. The restoration of degraded land brings economic resilience, creates jobs, raises incomes and increases food security. 

Restoring degraded land brings economic resilience, creates jobs, raises incomes and increases food security. It helps biodiversity to recover. It locks away the atmospheric carbon warming the Earth, slowing climate change. It can also lessen the impacts of climate change and underpin a green recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. LAND is part of the solution! Link In Bio to learn more.

.

La desertificación es la degradación de la tierra en las zonas áridas, semiáridas y subhúmedas secas. Está causada fundamentalmente por la actividad humana y las variaciones climáticas. Este proceso no hace referencia al avance de los desiertos existentes. La desertificación se debe a la vulnerabilidad de los ecosistemas de zonas secas, que cubren un tercio de la superficie del planeta, a la sobrexplotación y el uso inadecuado de la tierra. (ONU)

Nella Giornata Mondiale della Lotta alla Desertificazione e Siccità, vogliamo sottolineare quanto combattere l'impoverimento del suolo sia un obiettivo importante e tangibile.  
 
🌲 Un suolo sano, umido e ricco di piante favorisce la biodiversità e diventa la casa di tante specie di animali e piante, che mantengono l'ambiente in equilibrio 🐿️ 
 
🌱 Un suolo fertile permette la coltivazione, incoraggiando lo sviluppo delle comunità locali e creando lavoro e possibilità di sostentamento per tutti 🧑‍🌾 
 
É questa la filosofia che sta dietro a treedom_trees: effettuando un ordine di Elisi o Unica, non solo pianterai un seme, ma combatterai l'erosione del suolo, proteggerai la biodiversità e aiuterai direttamente i contadini locali, dando loro un mezzo di sostentamento e opportunità di formarsi. Tutto questo con un solo ordine.

😲Today almost half of the world's population is directly or indirectly affected by land degradation!

Desertification does not refer to the expansion of existing deserts. It actually occurs because dryland ecosystems are highly vulnerable to overexploitation and inappropriate land use, such as overgrazing, deforestation, and soil pollution.

What can you do? 🌱

✔Get informed about our land issues and spread the message.
✔Promote sustainable systems as the circular economy to combat desertification.
✔Plant a tree (it helps!)
🧐Read the next post for an inspiring story about the powerful effect of planting trees. 
✔Get to know circular and ethical products, aware of our environment, and care about it. 

🏡Visit us at www.shopc.io  to find out circular products.

Save landscapes, save humanity 🍃☘🍀
